Alzheimer's disease: This progressive neurodegenerative disease affects millions of people worldwide and causes significant suffering. A cure would have a huge impact on the quality of life of those affected and their families.

Tuberculosis: TB is a major public health problem in many parts of the world, causing significant morbidity and mortality. A cure would greatly reduce the burden of this disease on global health systems.

Malaria: This mosquito-borne disease is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in many developing countries. A cure would have a significant impact on the health of vulnerable populations and improve access to healthcare in these areas.
Parkinson's disease: This neurodegenerative disorder causes significant physical and cognitive decline. A cure would greatly improve the quality of life of those affected and their families.

HIV/AIDS: This disease has had a devastating impact on global health, causing significant morbidity and mortality. A cure would have a profound impact on the lives of those affected and their families, as well as on the broader global health community.
